newsitem.title: USA: Ascend net up 139 pct, Cascade sales growth slows.
newsitem.headline: Ascend net up 139 pct, Cascade sales growth slows.

text.p: ALAMEDA, Calif., April 10 (Reuter) Ascend Communications Corp. on Thursday said first quarter net income before charges rose 139 percent from a year earlier, whiles its merger partner Cascade Communications Corp. reported a big loss after a charge for an acquisition.
Alameda, Calif.-based Ascend said net income for the three months to March 31 rose to $46.3 million, or 36 cents a share, from $19.4 million or 15 cents a share in the year-earlier first quarter.
This was slightly above Wall Street's consensus estimate of 33 cents a share, according to First Call.
First quarter net sales for the fast-growing maker of remote networking products was $202.4 million, up 120 percent from $92 million in the first quarter of 1996.

Westford, Mass.-based Cascade Communications Corp., reported a loss of $198.3 million, or $2.13 per share, for its first fiscal quarter ended March 29, after a one-time charge of $213.1 million related to its acquisition of Sahara Networks.
Excluding the charge, Cascade reported earnings of $14.8 million, or 15 cents a share, compared with net income of $10.4 million, or 11 cents a share a year ago.

Revenues for the first quarter rose 61 percent to $90.3 million from $56.0 million for the same period in 1996, but this was down 18 percent from $110.3 million sequentially from the previous, fourth quarter in an industry where large double-digit sequential quarterly gains are the norm.

Ascend's acquisition in a stock exchange was initially valued at $3.7 billion, but the value has since slipped --- falling below $3 billion at one point -- along with declines in the company's stock price.
